text: Holland-Dozier-Holland was a songwriting and production team made up of Lamont Dozier and brothers Brian and Eddie Holland. They wrote many songs that made the Motown sound in the 1960s. They were known for producing albums and writing songs for the Four Tops and the Supremes, including 10 out of the Supremes' 12 US No. 1 singles, such as "Baby Love", "Stop! In the Name of Love", and "You Keep Me Hangin' On". ==References== Category:Writers from Detroit
title: Holland–Dozier–Holland
